presenter.name: Dong-Wan Seo
presenter.title: Korea
presenter.bio: EUS-Guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation: When and How

slide.title: EUS-Guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation: When and How
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided pancreatic cyst ablation: when and how
slide.text:
EUS-Guided Pancreatic Cyst Ablation: When and How
Dong Wan Seo Department of Gastroenterology, Asan Medical Center University of Ulsan College of Medicine, Seoul, Korea

slide.title: Areas to be covered
slide.notes:
Can do chemical analysis, tumor marker study and cytology.
If amylase level is high, it suggest the possibility of pseudocyst or IPMN. If CEA level is very high or cystic fluid shows high viscosity, the probability of mucinous lesion is quite high. If cytology shows any malignant cell, we can diagnose cancer transformation from mucinous tumor.
slide.notesNormalized:
can do chemical analysis, tumor marker study and cytology.
if amylase level is high, it suggest the possibility of pseudocyst or ipmn. if cea level is very high or cystic fluid shows high viscosity, the probability of mucinous lesion is quite high. if cytology shows any malignant cell, we can diagnose cancer transformation from mucinous tumor.
slide.notesHtml:
Can do chemical analysis, tumor marker study and cytology.

If amylase level is high, it suggest the possibility of pseudocyst or IPMN.

If CEA level is very high or cystic fluid shows high viscosity, the probability of mucinous lesion is quite high.

If cytology shows any malignant cell, we can diagnose cancer transformation from mucinous tumor.
slide.text:
When: indications
How: technical details
Areas to be covered

slide.title: Patient selection
slide.notes: Included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors. We applied very strict exclusion criteria. Typical pseudocyst or serous cystadenoma based on hx and imaging studies, Overt cystadenocarcinoma or extensive disease, IPMN, Cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on ERP Were all excluded from this study.
slide.notesNormalized: included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors. we applied very strict exclusion criteria. typical pseudocyst or serous cystadenoma based on hx and imaging studies, overt cystadenocarcinoma or extensive disease, ipmn, cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on erp were all excluded from this study.

Included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors.

IPMN,

Cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on ERP

Were all excluded from this study.
slide.text: MCN, SCN, IPMN, SPN donâ€™t have histologic diagnosis only presumed diagnosis Patient selection Not based on histology Included cystic tumors unilocular or oligocystic tumor size 2~6 cm

slide.text: Recommended Indication unilocular or oligocystic tumor size 2~6 cm presumed Dx of MCN, SCN, indeterminate cyst

We applied very strict exclusion criteria.

IPMN,

Cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on ERP

slide.text: Recommended Indication unilocular or oligocystic tumor size 2~6 cm presumed Dx of MCN, SCN, indeterminate cyst without clear MPD communication without evidence of malignancy

When: indications
How: technical details
Areas to be covered

slide.title: Techniques of cyst ablation
slide.notes: Included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors. We applied very strict exclusion criteria. Typical pseudocyst or serous cystadenoma based on hx and imaging studies, Overt cystadenocarcinoma or extensive disease, IPMN, Cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on ERP Were all excluded from this study.
slide.notesNormalized: included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors. we applied very strict exclusion criteria. typical pseudocyst or serous cystadenoma based on hx and imaging studies, overt cystadenocarcinoma or extensive disease, ipmn, cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on erp were all excluded from this study.
slide.notesHtml:
Included cystic tumors were unilocular cystic tumor or oligocystic tumors.

We applied very strict exclusion criteria.

Typical pseudocyst or serous cystadenoma based on hx and imaging studies,

Overt cystadenocarcinoma or extensive disease,

IPMN,

Cystic tumor which shows communication with main pancreatic duct on ERP

Were all excluded from this study.
slide.text:
Techniques of cyst ablation Classic ethanol lavage
Ethanol retention therapy
Combined paclitaxel injection

slide.title: Ethanol lavage therapy (I)
slide.notes:
This patient shows a large cystic tumor in the tail. Upon EUS, we can identify several septations. We used 22G needle and punctured the cyst. The stylet was removed.
This is EUS view. Before puncture, we used Doppler to avoid any intervening vessel and punctured the cyst. Negative pressure was applied to aspirate cystic fluid. This is aspirated fluid.
Then we injected 100% ethanol, this is at the time of ethanol injection. Most of locules showed communication when we injected ethanol. If there is any non-communicating locule, we targetted it at the same session and injected ethanol.
Then we waited 20~40 minutes for the retention and removed the injected ethanol. Finally small amount paclitaxel was instillated.

this is eus view. before puncture, we used doppler to avoid any intervening vessel and punctured the cyst. negative pressure was applied to aspirate cystic fluid. this is aspirated fluid.

then we waited 20~40 minutes for the retention and removed the injected ethanol. finally small amount paclitaxel was instillated.

Finally small amount paclitaxel was instillated.

slide.text: Techniques of cyst ablation Classic ethanol lavage repeated injection & aspiration generally for small sized cyst unilocular or bilocular cyst to avoid leakage

slide.title: Ethanol retention therapy (I)
slide.notes:
This patient shows a large cystic tumor in the tail. Upon EUS, we can identify several septations. We used 22G needle and punctured the cyst. The stylet was removed.
This is EUS view. Before puncture, we used Doppler to avoid any intervening vessel and punctured the cyst. Negative pressure was applied to aspirate cystic fluid. This is aspirated fluid.
Then we injected 100% ethanol, this is at the time of ethanol injection. Most of locules showed communication when we injected ethanol. If there is any non-communicating locule, we targetted it at the same session and injected ethanol.
Then we waited 20~40 minutes for the retention and removed the injected ethanol. Finally small amount paclitaxel was instillated.

This patient shows a large cystic tumor in the tail.

slide.text: Ethanol retention therapy (I)

slide.title: Aspirated cystic fluid: 140cc
slide.notes:
About 7cm sized oligocystic lesion was noted in the tail of the pancreas. There was no mural nodule and cyst in cyst pattern was noted. The MPD showed normal caliber.
After EUS guidance, the cystic lesion in the body was punctured using 22G aspiration needle. Then cystic fluid was aspirated. It showed clear color and the amount was about 140 ml. After aspiration, 99% ethanol was injected into the cystic cavity (100 ml) and retained in the cavity for 20 minutes. Then reaspiration was done. A total 30 mg paclitaxol was injected into the cyst after 1:1 dilution with distilled water (total volume 7 ml).
The whole procedure was complited without complication.
IMPRESSION) 1. Pancreatic cystic lesion (Oligocyst, cyst in cyst pattern, no mural nodule) Mucinous cystic neoplasm, more likely 2. EUS-guided ethanol lavage was performed without complication

the whole procedure was complited without complication.

slide.notesHtml:
About 7cm sized oligocystic lesion was noted in the tail of the pancreas.

There was no mural nodule and cyst in cyst pattern was noted.

The MPD showed normal caliber.

After EUS guidance, the cystic lesion in the body was punctured using 22G aspiration

needle. Then cystic fluid was aspirated. It showed clear color and the amount

was about 140 ml. After aspiration, 99% ethanol was injected into the cystic

cavity (100 ml) and retained in the cavity for 20 minutes. Then reaspiration was

done. A total 30 mg paclitaxol was injected into the cyst after 1:1 dilution

with distilled water (total volume 7 ml).

The whole procedure was complited without complication.

IMPRESSION) 1. Pancreatic cystic lesion

(Oligocyst, cyst in cyst pattern, no mural nodule)

Mucinous cystic neoplasm, more likely

2. EUS-guided ethanol lavage was performed without complication

slide.text:
Techniques of ethanol retention remove the needle & echoendoscope
rotate the patient in recovery room supine 5 min, lt lateral decubitus 5 min prone 5 min, rt lateral decubitus 5 min
reinsert echoendoscope & puncture cyst again

slide.title: Ethanol retention therapy (II)
slide.notes:
This patient shows a large cystic tumor in the tail. Upon EUS, we can identify several septations. We used 22G needle and punctured the cyst. The stylet was removed.
This is EUS view. Before puncture, we used Doppler to avoid any intervening vessel and punctured the cyst. Negative pressure was applied to aspirate cystic fluid. This is aspirated fluid.
Then we injected 100% ethanol, this is at the time of ethanol injection. Most of locules showed communication when we injected ethanol. If there is any non-communicating locule, we targetted it at the same session and injected ethanol.
Then we waited 20~40 minutes for the retention and removed the injected ethanol. Finally small amount paclitaxel was instillated.

slide.title: Indications of PCT ablation
slide.text: Indications of PCT ablation

slide.title: Technical details
slide.text:
size of needle: 19 or 22G agents: ethanol, paclitaxel, gemcitabine or lauromacrol aspirate 100% ?: not completely viscous fluid: 19G high pressure suction repeated inj & reasp
Technical details
